trans-unit.source: Use Azure Backup to replace your tape infrastructure | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Use Azure Backup to replace your tape infrastructure | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how Azure Backup provides tape-like semantics which enables you to backup and restore data in Azure
trans-unit.target: Learn how Azure Backup provides tape-like semantics which enables you to backup and restore data in Azure

trans-unit.source: Use Azure Backup to replace your tape infrastructure
trans-unit.target: Use Azure Backup to replace your tape infrastructure

trans-unit.source: Azure Backup and System Center Data Protection Manager customers can:
trans-unit.target: Azure Backup and System Center Data Protection Manager customers can:

trans-unit.source: Back up data in schedules which best suit their organization needs
trans-unit.target: Back up data in schedules which best suit their organization needs

trans-unit.source: Retain the backup data for longer periods
trans-unit.target: Retain the backup data for longer periods

trans-unit.source: Make Azure a part of their long term retention needs (instead of tape).
trans-unit.target: Make Azure a part of their long term retention needs (instead of tape).

trans-unit.source: This article explains how customers can enable backup and retention policies.
trans-unit.target: This article explains how customers can enable backup and retention policies.

trans-unit.source: Customers who use tapes to address their long-term-retention needs now have a powerful and viable alternative with the availability of this feature.
trans-unit.target: Customers who use tapes to address their long-term-retention needs now have a powerful and viable alternative with the availability of this feature.

trans-unit.source: The feature is enabled in the latest release of the Azure Backup (which is available <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: The feature is enabled in the latest release of the Azure Backup (which is available <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: SCDPM customers will need to move to UR5 before using this feature.
trans-unit.target: SCDPM customers will need to move to UR5 before using this feature.

trans-unit.source: What is the Backup Schedule?
trans-unit.target: What is the Backup Schedule?

trans-unit.source: The backup schedule indicates the frequency of the backup operation.
trans-unit.target: The backup schedule indicates the frequency of the backup operation.

trans-unit.source: For example, the settings in the screen below indicate that backups will be taken daily at 6pm and at midnight.
trans-unit.target: For example, the settings in the screen below indicate that backups will be taken daily at 6pm and at midnight.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Daily Schedule</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Daily Schedule</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Customers can also schedule a weekly backup. For example, the settings in the screen below indicate that backups will be taken every alternate Sunday & Wednesday at 9.30am and 1am.
trans-unit.target: Customers can also schedule a weekly backup. For example, the settings in the screen below indicate that backups will be taken every alternate Sunday & Wednesday at 9.30am and 1am.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Weekly Schedule</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Weekly Schedule</linkText>

trans-unit.source: What is the Retention Policy?
trans-unit.target: What is the Retention Policy?

trans-unit.source: The retention policy specifies the duration for which the backup must be stored.
trans-unit.target: The retention policy specifies the duration for which the backup must be stored.

trans-unit.source: Rather than just specifying a “flat policy” for all backup points, customers can specify different retention policies based on when the backup is taken.
trans-unit.target: Rather than just specifying a “flat policy” for all backup points, customers can specify different retention policies based on when the backup is taken.

trans-unit.source: For example, the backup point taken at the end of each quarter may need to be preserved for a longer duration for audit purposes while the backup point taken daily, which serves as an operational recovery point, needs to be preserved for 90 days.
trans-unit.target: For example, the backup point taken at the end of each quarter may need to be preserved for a longer duration for audit purposes while the backup point taken daily, which serves as an operational recovery point, needs to be preserved for 90 days.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Retention Policy</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Retention Policy</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The total number of “retention points” specified in this policy is 90 (daily points) + 40 (one each quarter for 10 years) = 130.
trans-unit.target: The total number of “retention points” specified in this policy is 90 (daily points) + 40 (one each quarter for 10 years) = 130.

trans-unit.source: Example – Putting both together
trans-unit.target: Example – Putting both together

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Sample Screen</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Sample Screen</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Daily retention policy: Backups taken daily are stored for 7 days.
trans-unit.target: Daily retention policy: Backups taken daily are stored for 7 days.

trans-unit.source: Weekly retention policy: Backups taken everyday at midnight and 6pm Saturday will be preserved for 4 weeks
trans-unit.target: Weekly retention policy: Backups taken everyday at midnight and 6pm Saturday will be preserved for 4 weeks

trans-unit.source: Monthly retention policy: Backups taken at midnight and 6pm on the last Saturday of each month will be preserved for 12months
trans-unit.target: Monthly retention policy: Backups taken at midnight and 6pm on the last Saturday of each month will be preserved for 12months

trans-unit.source: Yearly retention policy: Backups taken at midnight on the last Saturday of every March will be preserved for 10 years
trans-unit.target: Yearly retention policy: Backups taken at midnight on the last Saturday of every March will be preserved for 10 years

trans-unit.source: The total number of “retention points” (points from which a customer can restore data) in the above diagram is computed as follows:
trans-unit.target: The total number of “retention points” (points from which a customer can restore data) in the above diagram is computed as follows:

trans-unit.source: 2 points per day for 7 days = 14 recovery points
trans-unit.target: 2 points per day for 7 days = 14 recovery points

trans-unit.source: 2 points per week for 4 weeks = 8 recovery points
trans-unit.target: 2 points per week for 4 weeks = 8 recovery points

trans-unit.source: 2 points per month for 12 months = 24 recovery points
trans-unit.target: 2 points per month for 12 months = 24 recovery points

trans-unit.source: 1 point per year per 10 years = 10 recovery points
trans-unit.target: 1 point per year per 10 years = 10 recovery points

trans-unit.source: The total number of recovery points is 56.
trans-unit.target: The total number of recovery points is 56.

trans-unit.source: Advanced configuration
trans-unit.target: Advanced configuration

trans-unit.source: By clicking Modify in the above screen, customers have further flexibility in specifying retention schedules.
trans-unit.target: By clicking Modify in the above screen, customers have further flexibility in specifying retention schedules.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Modify</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Modify</linkText>
